data.title: Fix implicit conversion issues with Xcode 7.3
data.body:
Hi, I get the following errors when building `cpp-tests Mac` target on Xcode 7.3 (since commit https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/107cef06672279d6332b226ad2f4b24e132ea48e):

```
cocos/base/CCVector.h:291:75: Implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'unsigned long' to 'int'
cocos/base/CCMap.h:349:76: Implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'unsigned long' to 'int'
```

This pull request fixes the implicit conversion issues.

data.title: sqlite localStorageSetItem error
Fixes wrong usage of std::vector's constructor in EventDispatcher::removeAllEventListener.
data.body:
Please refer to http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/vector/vector/vector

std::vector<>(n), n means `resize` the vector to n size rather than `reserve`.

data.title: Label with TTF font error
data.body:
I am using Cocos2d-x-3.9 and have tried to use Cocos2d-x-3.10 and still experienced the following issue with **Label::createWithTTF**.
As you can see from the pictures, the words just have some random marks around them. If I use **getLetter(int index)**, then the errors happen even more often, sometimes the letters just get overlapped with each other.
Here is our code
https://github.com/haanhman/Label/blob/master/Classes/HelloWorldScene.cpp

data.title: v3.11 #if not is not a legal C++ preprocessor directive.
data.body:
# if not  is not a legal C++ preprocessor directive and it causes an "unexpected tokens following preprocessor directive" warning in Visual Studio.

For example:
# if not CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS is not a legal C++ preprocessor directive.

Here are all of the incorrect preprocessor directives:

 D:\GitHub\cocos2d-x-v3\cocos\scripting\js-bindings\manual\cocos2d_specifics.cpp(2221):#if not CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS
  D:\GitHub\cocos2d-x-v3\cocos\scripting\js-bindings\manual\cocos2d_specifics.cpp(2236):#if not CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS
  D:\GitHub\cocos2d-x-v3\cocos\scripting\js-bindings\manual\ScriptingCore.cpp(219):#if not CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS
  D:\GitHub\cocos2d-x-v3\cocos\scripting\js-bindings\manual\ScriptingCore.cpp(2195):#if not CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS
  D:\GitHub\cocos2d-x-v3\cocos\scripting\js-bindings\manual\ScriptingCore.cpp(2265):#if not CC_ENABLE_GC_FOR_NATIVE_OBJECTS

data.title: launchimage of iphone5/5s on ios7.x/ios8.x?
data.body:
my game is landscape,this is my info.plist for iphone5/iphone5s

<dict>
            <key>UILaunchImageMinimumOSVersion</key>
            <string>6.0</string>
            <key>UILaunchImageName</key>
            <string>Default-568h</string>
            <key>UILaunchImageOrientation</key>
            <string>Portrait</string>
            <key>UILaunchImageSize</key>
            <string>{320, 568}</string>
        </dict>

 it's just worked for  iphone5/5s on ios9.x ios6.x, but not on  ios7.x ios8.x,it doese not show launchimages on these os versions.

my cocos2dx-lua version is v3.3.

data.title: VSync and Inconsistent Performance Issues on Windows
data.body:
Posting this issue to help get it looked at and hopefully a PR once a fix is determined.
http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/cocos2d-x-windows-performance-issues-examined/27915/
https://randomascii.wordpress.com/2013/04/02/sleep-variation-investigated/

This PR fixed the busy waiting, but introduces sleep(1) which potentially waits for 15ms instead of 1ms.
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/9368

data.title: Incorrect screen positioning and scale while launching app from the lock screen on Android
data.body: Hi, I am using Cocos2d-x 3.8.1. My game runs only in the **landscape** mode I've implemented local notifications on Android similar to [https://github.com/kobakei/CCLocalNotification](https://github.com/kobakei/CCLocalNotification). But it is not so important. If I exit the game via `Director::getInstance()->end();` then wait for notification to appear and launch the game via this notification from the lock screen Instead of this image I have this one Additional information: - if the game is in a device memory all works fine - If launch the game via local notification but not from the lock screen, all works fine - The issue is reproducible on a tablet if it is in the portrait mode and all works fine when you try to reproduce in the landscape mode I am ready to give any additional information.

data.title: Animations with only one frame are allowed now.
data.body:
If an animation with only a frame is created on Cocos Studio UI 1.6, it is loaded in html5 [correctly](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-html5/pull/2884), but not in native now. Example:

![Cocos Studio 16 One Frame Animation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3737721/7534707/535903b0-f57d-11e4-93dc-7dffbf0a7379.png)

The behaviour is the same now.

data.title: MenuItemSprite requires 2 parameters or fails silently
data.body:
If you are working with `MenuItemImage` you can add a button with a single image like this:

```
var playButton = new cc.MenuItemImage('res/playButton.png');
```

You can pass a second parameter to specify a different image for the _selected_ status, but that's not necessary.

You would expect the same behavior with MenuItemSprite, but unfortunately, something like this...

```
var playButton = new cc.MenuItemSprite(sprite);
```

will do nothing. No sprites will be actually added to the menu item.

data.title: proposed new template idea
data.body:
This is a proposed idea for a new template. The goal was to show the users something more interesting than the current template as well as demonstrate a better coding practice (i.e not needing to subclass Layer).

This is not ready for merge. I would still need to 
- finish for the other platforms and test.
- clean up AppDelegate.

Please review the idea and check out the way I coded it. I wanted to give good comments and demonstrate practices like using Node, Sprite, std::vector as a way to store objects, Physics, Actions, Sequences, clone(), etc.

data.title: Socket.io bottleneck / weird buffering
data.body:
Hi everybody,

I set up a test project of cocos2d-JS with socket.io. In the cocos2d app I scheduled an update function (about every 16ms, with `this.scheduleUpdate()` ), and during every update cycle I tried to send a signal to the socket.io server via `socket.emit()`. When I set the server up to measure how many incoming signals there are per second, weird things happen:
- in cocos2d-html5 (`cocos run -p web`) the received signals max out at around 60 signals per second. Everything looks fine.
- when I compile a Linux binary (`cocos run -p linux`) the received signals max out at 20 per second BUT they are buffered from 60 per second. Meaning the app actually generates 60 socket.emit()s per second, but only send them out 20 at a time. Therefore 1 second of app runtime will generate 3 seconds of signals with 20 signals each. 

This creates a huge lag in any live-multiplayer scenario. Can anybody reproduce this, please, or is this a well-known bug by any chance? It just seems arbitrary.

The only solution I found so far was to limit the cocos2d app to only ever send 20 emits per second.

data.title: Iterator erase pattern
data.body: Should update the iterator with return value instead of incrementing after erase. This matches the rest of the code base that already has this erase iterator inside loop pattern.

data.title: Bug in nexus 5
Update OpenSSL for libcurl
data.body: Some developers met the issue on Android: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/openssl-problem-again/28270. I think we should update it in v3.11, and it seems there is pull request in https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-src/pull/80.
